Hi team,
Please help me with the correct response to the prospect. Is it better to raise a support ticket for this?
They already opened two I think.
Thank you!

_I have just spent 4 hours going through each person’s schedule. i had got to letter J - Julia Toms, everything was looking fine and agains same issue as yesterday all my bookings have vanished?_

_Is this an issue you have seen before?_

thread.text:
This was a bug where plans would disappear from the screen when more resource were loaded by scrolling down.
They are all still there however, re-appear on refresh.

We have fixed this bug now, I will let you know when the fix is out to production

hmm there seems to be some issue with trains our deployment system, I’ll let you know when that is resolved and the fix is deployed. Until then you could tell them that we are aware of this bug and that a fix is coming, in the meantime if they do a browser refresh they should see the plans.
This issue happens if there are more than 50 resources in the grid, another workaround until the fix is deployed is to use the filters to reduce the number of users in the grid that they are working with at any given time

text: hello team – there’s a recent question on TempoLab about setting logged time to non-billable hours by default, do we have any workarounds? _When I register the hours Time by default considers them as billable hours. Will it be possible in future to treat them as non-billable hours by default? This may be convenient in some cases or boards so would it be possible to have the option to choose this setting per board or project?_

thread.text:
There is no workaround for this unless the issue is set as an Internal issue in Tempo.
Internal issues have by default 0h billable.
We do have quite a number of feature requests to set billable hours to 0 when the issue / worklog is connected to a non-billable Account
<https://ideas.tempo.io/ideas/search?query=billable+hours+>

Some users have also asked about an option to set a default value for billable hours instead of having it the same as worked hours.
*<http://ideas.tempo.io|ideas.tempo.io>*
*<https://ideas.tempo.io/ideas/search?query=billable+hours+|Tempo Ideas>*

text:
hi Team,

just wanted to double-check the following for TS Cloud

1. _Is it possible in Tempo Timesheets to specify the time of closing a period? The documentation states that the time for closing a period is 11:59 PM on the set day. We are looking into setting it to 5:00 PM if possible._ - no, weekly or monthly basis
2. _Is it possible to set a due date for timesheet approval? If yes, can we set a specific time? I haven’t seen a documentation around this_. - monthly or weekly approvals can be configured as well

thread.text:
1. it’s not possible to specific time of closing day.
2. Scheduler can close period with reminder. <https://help.tempo.io/cloud/en/tempo-timesheets/setting-up-and-configuring-tempo-timesheets/setting-up-timesheet-periods-for-approvals.html>

text:
Happy Friday, team! :partygopher: Would anyone have an answer for a prospect interested in Budgets for DC is asking, “_As our organization is transitioning to Code-craft, will the “Tempo Budget” tool be compatible with Code-craft as well?”_
(I’m not familiar with Code-craft at all!)

thread.text: You can probably say something generic like “Tempo Budgets is a *Jira* add-on and will pull and analyze data stored in Jira (e.g. tasks, worklogs,). It is also possible to integrate from an external application using Tempo Budgets public <https://www.tempo.io/server-api-documentation/budgets|API.>

text: In Cost Tracker is it possible to set up your Teams and Rates before someone has logged time? Talking with someone now and we can only seem to set a rate or see someone in Cost Tracker after they have logged time….

thread.text: currently the option is to setup rates by Role under Global Settings > Cost Rates. We’re also coming soon with Planner integration which will allow setting up project team member rates for anyone who has *planned* time on the project scope as well (not needing logged time anymore). This feature will come this summer.

The teams are generated automatically from everyone who has logged time to the projects/issues defined in your JQL for your Cost Tracker project so a “team” doesn’t show up until someone logs time to those issues.

<https://help.tempo.io/cloud/en/tempo-cost-tracker/working-with-the-project-team.html>
